sentences.english: This is inescapably a religious task.
sentences.chinese: 這無法逃遁地是一個宗教信仰任務。

sentences.english: British weakness was underlined when the French fleet escaped from Toulon.
sentences.chinese: 法國艦隊從土倫逃遁一事反映出了英國的弱點。

sentences.english: Wild Turkeys are masters of camouflage and evasion.
sentences.chinese: 野火雞是巧於僞裝，敏於逃遁的大師。

sentences.english: The little ship tried to escape when the big pirate ship bore down.
sentences.chinese: 發現巨大的海盜船向它逼近時，那艘小船奮力逃遁。

sentences.english: I was his Wednesday girl- a sort of mid-week escape.
sentences.chinese: 我是他的星期三情人，一週中間一天的逃遁。

sentences.english: The difficulties encountered can not be untied, to escape this way.
sentences.chinese: 碰到解不開的難關，就以這種方法逃遁。

sentences.english: They bugged out as fast as planes and ships would bear them.
sentences.chinese: 他們儘快乘搭飛機和船隻，倉皇逃遁。

definition: to run away/to flee in disarray
to escape/to flee/to run for one's life
variant of 倉皇|仓皇[cang1 huang2]
to get away/to escape (from obligations)/to free oneself/to disengage
to flee from sth/to run away/to escape
to escape without trace (idiom); to make one's getaway (from the scene of a crime)/to show a clean pair of heels
to flee in disorder/to scurry off
to flee/to go into exile (from prison)
